sn7.20:4.2: Then a begging brahmin went up to the Buddha,
sn7.20:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn7.20:4.6: “Master Gotama, both you and I are beggars. What, then, is the difference between us?”
sn7.20:5.3: Someone who has accepted domestic responsibilities
sn7.20:5.4: has not yet become a mendicant.
sn7.20:6.1: But one living a spiritual life
sn7.20:6.2: who has shunned both good and bad,
sn7.20:6.3: having considered, they live in this world:
sn7.20:7.1: When he had spoken, the begging brahmin said to the Buddha:
sn7.20:7.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
